title: 105_hr2537
content: The Act titled "Uniformed Services Former Spouses Equity Act of 1997" terminates payments to former spouses upon remarriage. The Act "Uniformed Services Former Spouses Equity Act of 1997" terminates payments to former spouses upon remarriage, effective as of the last day of the month in which the remarriage occurs. This applies to marriages terminated by court orders issued before, on, or after the date of the enactment of this Act. The amendment to the court order will only apply to a member's retired pay payable for months starting more than 180 days after the enactment of this Act. SEC. 3. Retired pay based on retiree's length of service and pay grade at time of divorce. Section 1408(c) of title 10, United States Code is amended to include provisions for calculating disposable retired pay for a member in the case of divorce before retirement. The pay grade and length of service at the time of the final decree are used to determine the amount, which is then adjusted for increases in retired pay up to the retirement date. The Secretary will recompute and adjust payments to former spouses from a member's disposable retired pay based on court orders issued before the enactment of the Act. The amendment applies to court orders issued on or after June 25, 1981. LIMITATION ON TIME FOR SEEKING DIVISION OF RETIRED PAY: The amendment applies to court orders issued on or after June 25, 1981. The Uniformed Services Former Spouses Equity Act of 1997 amended section 1408 of title 10, United States Code, regarding the treatment of disposable retired pay of military members by courts. Courts must have jurisdiction over the member and the spouse must obtain a court order for retired pay apportionment within two years of divorce. The Uniformed Services Former Spouses Equity Act of 1997 amended section 1408 of title 10, United States Code, regarding the treatment of disposable retired pay of military members by courts. The amendment applies to final decrees of divorce, dissolution, annulment, or legal separation issued on or after June 25, 1981. SEC. 5. LIMITATION ON APPORTIONMENT OF DISABILITY PAY WHEN RETIRED PAY HAS BEEN WAIVED. Amendments are made to section 1408 of title 10, United States Code, and section 459 of the Social Security Act regarding the treatment of retired pay and compensation under title 38. Amendments to section 1408 of title 10, United States Code and section 459 of the Social Security Act involve changes to retired pay and compensation under title 38. The amendments apply to court orders issued on or after June 25, 1981, affecting military retired pay waived for service-connected disability compensation. The amendments to section 1408 of title 10, United States Code and section 459 of the Social Security Act apply to retired pay payable for months beginning on or after the enactment of this Act.
